page.title: 18THE HIGHAM MILL
page.content: THE COTTON IS MADE IN PADIAM AND IT IS DYED IN HIGHAM.HIGHAM MILL WAS COTTON A COTTON MILL A LONG TIME AGO. THE MILLS NAME IS CLOVERBROOK MILL.IT WAS BUILT IN 1852.THE MILL HAS GOT SOME VANS THAT THE COTTON IS CARRIED IN.THE COLOUR IS GREEN AND WHITE.THE COTTON GOES INTO THE DYEHOUSE IN EACH DYEING MACHINE.THEN INTO THE SLTTER AND DOWN INTO THE STENTER WHICH IS 170 DEGREES C.THEN ON TO THE "A" FRAMES. THEN TO THE INSPECTION PLACE.THE THINGS THAT THEY DYE ARE POLYESTER , COTTON,ACRYLIC,NYLON WHICH IS ALSO CALLED(TACTEL).THE MATERIAL IS TAKEN TO BE MADE IN TO FOOTBALL STRIPS.THERE ARE 60 PEOPLE WHO WORK IN THE MILL .90% DO NOT LIVE IN THE VILLAGE.THE THINGS GO TO SWEDEN, DENMARK,FRANCE AND LONDON.
